laboratory_examinations.findings: Right eye: 20/30, Left eye: 20/100 pinholing to 20/25.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Visual acuity decreased from 20/30 to 10/200 in the right eye over 2 months.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Central scotoma noted, with peripapillary atrophy and enlarged blind spots.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Central scotoma development in the right eye concurrent with rapid decline in visual acuity.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Hyperpigmented and hypopigmented areas detected; no bone spicule pigmentation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: A small subfoveal hemorrhage was noted in February 2001.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Dropped from 20/60 in the right eye to 20/80; subsequently dropped to 20/400 pinholing to 20/200.
No anatomic cause for the decrease in acuity.
Patient was heterozygous for a substitution mutation at the CHM gene (3/H11032 splice site of intron 6, 850â€“1 G to C).
Roughened, granular pattern of the RPE and irregular pigmentation without widespread atrophy.
Subretinal changes consistent with fibrosis and cystoid edema in the right eye.
Stable at 20/400 in the right eye and 20/30 in the left eye.
